The Quiz of the Month for October was organised today at V4. It saw the participation of more than 50 students.
The Prelims were conducted in lone wolf format and top 24 students were divided into teams of three.
The QMs were Piyush Kedia and Rupam Kumar Dubey.
The results are as follows:
I: Shubham, Pinaki Mishra, Pankaj Mishra
II: Abhimanyu Bharade, Sourav Chirania, Pratik Zaware
III: Harsh Agarwal, Venkatesh Jaiswal, Naimesh Pramanik 

Quiz of the Month is a new initiative we have taken to reach out to a larger audience, in addition, to the usual suspects at QC sessions, which are conducted bi-weekly in most of the weeks. There are prizes as well for podium finishes as well.
We'd be having more such events in the coming months, so watch out for those quizzes.

We bring to you the newest initiative by the Quiz Club -- the first Quiz Of The Month!

The Economics Society of St. Stephen’s College is proud to present its annual quizzing event, Ecquizzite 2018!

If the world of economics and business fascinates you, then Ecquizzite is just for you! Gear up for some thrilling rounds and interesting questions on economic theory, business trivia and financial concepts, with new compelling twists and turns in the format in this year's edition!

The rules for the event are as follows:
• Prelims and finals will be held on campus on Friday, September 13, 2018 from 2pm onwards

• Participation - Teams of two people are allowed. Lone wolves and cross college teams are also welcome. Undergraduate students are eligible to participate.

Register at: https://tinyurl.com/ecquizzite2018

Find the event page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/799276600462103/

Building on the highs of the previous year, IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club organised the Freshers' Quiz on 14th August in V3. This was the first time in three years that such an event was held, and needless to say, the first years did not disappoint. Never had we seen such a bumper turnout of 78 teams, with the levels of enthusiasm being off the charts.

After an engaging prelims, we were able to select the top 8 teams into the finals, with the cut-off at 15/26. Shoutout to Team Box(Dewang Gogte, Rashil Gandhi, Shikhar Mohan) and Team Thundering Typhoons (Pratyaya Bhattacharya, Arusarka Bose, Saswata Banerjee) who narrowly missed the cutoff at 14.5 and 14 respectively. The finals started off with all teams neck to neck, before the eventual winners pulled away from the pack, and sealed the quiz by a large margin. The battle for third place was a close-run thing, with two teams tying on the last question and requiring to be separated by a tiebreaker.

Final Standings - 

First - Pranav Krishnan, Srihari Viswajit, Parth Devdhe (205)
Second - Mihir Shrivastava, Shah Rukh Khan, Pratyaya Bhattacharya (135)
Third - Nikhil Kumar, Devika Narayanan, Prashik Deshpande (110)
Fourth - Anshuman Agarwal, Deepak Somani, Hardik Tibrewal (110)
Congratulations to the winners! We hope the turnouts and enthusiasm remain as high in the regular Quiz Club sessions in future.
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club added 10 new photos — with Abhimanyu Bharade and 6 others.

Third - Nikhil Kumar, Devika Narayanan, Prashik Deshpande (110)

Congratulations to the winners! We hope the turnouts and enthusiasm remain as high in the regular Quiz Club sessions in future.

Hello peeps!

Announcing "On Life, Universe and the 4-4-2", the Bombay Quiz Club's quiz inspired by the World Cup.

This is a General Quiz inspired by the World Cup (and all the stuff that happens inside and outside of the football pitch). For the football fans, yes, there will be questions on football. For those who do not follow football, there will be questions on life and universe (which is football in a different way).

The quiz will be a written one with questions run off a powerpoint slideshow (there will be AV). 

The quiz is a team quiz, each team is made up of 2 people. There are no restrictions of any kind.

Venue: Sports Library, Gymkhana

Proctor: Mohit Tulsyan

Time and Date: 4pm , Sunday, 22nd July 2018

Oh and in case you are wondering what a general quiz on the world cup is - here is the last (which was the first and so far only) edition

https://www.slideshare.net/anannya.deb/on-life-universe-and-the-4-42

Entry Fees - Pen and Paper

See you on Sunday!

Come one, come all!

As another semester and year comes to a close, we wanted to report on the flurry of activities that took place over the last semester. Apart from holding its first ever quiz week open to all KGPians, the quiz club regulars actively participated in a plethora of quizzes all across the country. Here is a brief look at our performance in some of them.

Starting with the Inter IIT Cultural Meet where IIT Kharagpur emerged as the champion in the quizzing event by bagging a Silver in the India Quiz (team of Piyush Kedia, Shubham and Ashutosh); Silver in the MELA quiz (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Baibhab Pattnaik and Piyush Kedia); Bronze in the Sports Quiz (team of Abhimany Bharade, Piyush Kedia and Deepanshu Sinha) and a Gold in the General Quiz (team of Shubham, Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)

Winner, India Quiz, Nihilanth 2018, IIM Ahmedabad (team of Harsh Agrawal, Baibhab Pattnaik, Abhimanyu Bharade)

Winners, General Quiz, KPC Medical College(team of Ashutosh Dwivedi, Piyush Kedia)
2nd Runner Up, U-25 Quiz, Gyandhara at IIEST Shibpur(Team of Ashutosh Dwivedi, Piyush Kedia, Baibhab Pattnaik)
Winners. General Quiz, Convolution at Jadavpur University(Team of Ashutosh Dwivedi, Baibhab Pattnaik, Amit Kumar Ram)
Runners Up, HAIR Quiz, Heritage Quiz Festival (Team of Amit Kumar Ram, Mayank Roy, Ashutosh Dwivedi)
Runners Up, Bizzathlon at NIT Jamshedpur(Team of Piyush Kedia, Abhimanyu Bharade)
Regional Finalist, Tata Crucible Campus Quiz ( Team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia)
Winners, BizTech Quiz, GES IIT KGP(Team of Harsh Agarwal, Shubham, Abhimanyu Bharade)
2nd Runners Up, Biztech Quiz, GES IIT KGP(Team of Rupam Kumar Dubey, Harsha Vattem)
Winners, Quizzario, Vinculum at VGSoM(Team of Amit Kumar Ram, Piyush Kedia)
2nd Runners Up, Quizzario, Vinculum at VGSoM(Team of Shubham, Venkatesh Jaiswal)
Winners, Quiz, NIFT Kolkata( Team of Venkatesh Jaiswal, Piyush Kedia)
Winners, Quizzomania, Impulse IIT KGP ( Team of Shubham, Abhimanyu Bharade)
Runners Up, Quizzomania, Impulse IIT KGP ( Team of Piyush Kedia, Mohit Tulsyan)
Winners, Tech Quiz, COMPOSIT( Team of Mohit Tulsyan, Mayank Roy, Bhutwala Raj, Sourav Kundu)
Runners Up, Tech Quiz, COMPOSIT( Team of Piyush Kedia, Abhimanyu Bharade)
Runners Up, Megalith( Team of Piyush Kedia, Harsh Agarwal)
2nd Runners Up, Megalith( Team of Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy, Baibhab Pattnaik, Amit Kumar Ram) 
Runners Up, WIPRO Quiz, Spring Fest( Team of Rupam Kumar Dubey, Kaustav Mandal)
Winners, Biz Quiz, Kshitij( Team of Shubham, Harsh Agarwal, Piyush Kedia, Abhimanyu Bharade, Abhinav Jha)

With this, the final quiz of the session will be hosted on Sunday,15th April by the outgoing Governors. All interested, do drop in. Further details will be posted on the page.

Hey everyone, thanks for coming for any of the quizzes that you came to till now. If you haven't and even if you have, please come for the final two quizzes of the Quiz Week today from 1:30 PM on Sunday to beat the heat.
We promise it is going to be interesting like all the quizzes till now.
Sourav Kundu and Abhimanyu Bharade are setting the Sci-Tech quiz set to start by 1:30 PM and then you have one of the most awaited quizzes of the Quiz Week, the Pop-Culture Quiz, which has been set by Hemansh Kashyap and Mayank Roy from 7:30 PM in V3.

See you there and bring all of your friends along too!

P.S: Bring Your Own Pens

message: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post. General Quiz and Biz Quiz | Quiz Week Day 5 Day 5 saw a very busy day with quizzes after quizzes going on at Vikramshila. General Quiz started early in the afternoon with people gathering being treated with a dose of everything in the world. After that, the Biz Quiz took place in the evening and saw a very topsy-turvy finale with the final spots getting chosen in the final few questions. Results: General Quiz: First: Amit Kumar Ram, Agnimitra Anand, Pranav Joshi (260) Second: Piyush Kedia, Rupam Kumar Dubey, Vaibhav Krishna (210) Third: Kaustav Mandal, Kaniska Ghosh + 1 (205) Biz Quiz: First: Piyush Kedia, Kaustav Mandal, Anmol Joshi (270) Second: Sourav Chirania, Harsha Vattem, Siddhant Ladha (240) Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Anurag Mondal, Shubhra Agrawal (230) The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and wishes IIT KGP Quiz Club best of luck for the last day of the Quiz Week tomorrow.

message: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post. MELA Quiz | Quiz Week Day 4 Day 4 saw a lot of the MELA enthusiasts in the campus turn up for the quiz which turned out to be a very entertaining, exciting and close affair right down till the last question when the podium was finally decided. This time around, all the participants who qualified from the prelims stayed back to sit for the finals and made the event a success. First: Agnimitra Anand, Kaniska Ghosh, Mayank Roy Second: R. Srihari, Anurag Kar, Prachurjya Biswas Third: Mohit Tulsyan, Nikhil Nayan Jha, Varun PD The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and the QMs on an exciting quiz and wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club the best of luck for the four quizzes to be held in the next two days.

Women's Quiz | Quiz Week Day 3 Day 3, a veritable first for KGP quizzing in many ways saw a women-only quiz being conducted with 25 participants, which, compared to the norm of 2-3 women in regular quizzes was a huge improvement. It continued the trend of first-timers leaving right after prelims without waiting for the results for yet another day in a row where the third member of the (later on)first place team left, assuming she wouldn't qualify. Considering that almost all of the participants being first-time quizzers, the scores received in the prelims and finals results were very competitive. The aim of the event had been to try and introduce women to the sport and the response, especially in the finals from teams was very positive, with blocks and enthusiastic hint requests and clarifications going around on questions. The finals boiled down to a tie-breaker for third place and after three further tie-breaker questions which couldn't break the tie, the third place remained tied till the end in the final result. Prof. Seema Singh of the HSS department also graced the event with her presence and stayed almost till the end of the quiz. First: Sangeeta Roy, Shubhra Agrawal (225) Second: Ayushi Mrigen, Nikita Gautam, Kavana Rao (135) Third: Shubhi Jain, Abhigna Revuru, Nayan Kubade (130) and Pankhuri Saxena, Samruddhi Pataskar and Pankhudi Jain (130) Fourth: (125) Fifth: (120) The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and hopes that this helps somewhat bridge the gender disparity in quizzing in the campus and further wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club best of luck for the future quizzes in this event.

India Quiz | Quiz Week: Day 2 Day 2 in the Intra-KGP Quiz Week saw an even higher participation from the KGP population, with similar scenes occurring with first timers as day one. Another prelims participant had to miss out because of low self-confidence about his own talent because he left for his hall without leaving any contact info. Both the prelims and finals were highly entertaining, with all the three podium places getting cleared out in the final three questions of the quiz with all the other teams chasing just 5-15 points behind. The point of female participation came up again today, but this time, there was some participation from the female populace and one of them even making it to the finals. First: Harsh Agarwal, Pinaki Mishra, Sourav Kundu (180) Second: Sourav Chirania, Baibhab Pattnaik, Kaniska Ghosh (150) Third: Satyam Agarwal, Pratik Gokul Zaware, Shreyans Sadangi (145) Fourth, Fifth, Sixth: (140) The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club all the best for today's Women Only Quiz.

IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post. Sports Quiz | Quiz Week : Day 1 Today saw the participation of close to 70 people for the prelims and we saw the greatest fear of most non-quizzers coming up in action and tackled head-on. Two people out of the 24 finalists scored higher than Quiz Club regulars and yet, because they thought they hadn't done well enough, left without even waiting for the results. One of them didn't submit their contact details so we couldn't even reach them to let them know and hence had to take the next highest scorer present. We later got to know that there were two-three people who didn't want to see if they could qualify and didn't submit their answer sheet for checking, where it turned out that they would've actually qualified for the finals. The team that won actually had a member like that, who after giving up, decided to go to his room, from where he had to be called to come back for the finals and eventually won. The finals itself was a cliffhanger with the podium places getting decided in the last two questions of the quiz. Furthermore, there were no women in attendance. An event, that has no barriers to entry, and no prerequisites for taking part, as well as cash prizes and refreshments where non-regulars to QC sessions turned up and performed very well had an entire section of our campus population giving it a miss in participation definitely speaks volumes about this. We invite discussion regarding this in the comments section, and more than discussion, ideas to improve this situation, considering that Quiz Club has brought laurels for the institute in multiple places throughout the past years and their current Quiz Week initiative is an attempt to lure in people who don't consider themselves knowledgeable enough. Final Results: First: B. Pattnaik, Bhart Singh, Sougata Paul (135) Second: Agnimitra Anand, Piyush Kedia, Hemansh Kashyap (120) Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Rajat Jain, Kaushal Vadera (118) Fourth Place: (115) The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes Quiz Club all the best for the rest of the quizzes to be held as part of Quiz Week.

message:
Quiz Club, IIT Kharagpur has had a very active year and we believe that all the students apart from the active people in the meetings should also have a chance at exploring their latent talent in this mindsport.
With this aim in mind, we bring to you 8 Quizzes over the course of  6 days from 6th March to 11th March.
All the quizzes will have assured prize money for the podium finishers and they will happen in a format that gives every person a good chance of entering the finals with a strong team.

Eligibility: Currently Studying Student in IIT Kharagpur
Prelims: SOLO, and top 24 advance to the finals
Finals: Top 24 are paired up together with Teams being formed in the following fashion:
1,24,9 is Team 1; 2,23,10 is Team 2 and so on till the 8 teams are formed.

The Quiz Topics are as follows:

Sports Quiz (6th March)
India Quiz (7th March)
Women's Quiz (Women Only) (8th March, on the occasion of International Women's Day)
MELA (Music, Entertainment, Literature, Arts) Quiz (9th March)
Sci-Tech Quiz (10th March, afternoon slot)
Biz Quiz (10th March, night slot)
General Quiz (11th March afternoon slot)
Pop Culture Quiz (11th March, night slot)
Date: 07:30PM
Time: 06-03-2018
Veunu: Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur

message:
Registrations for Interrobang 2018 are now open!
Please register through this form if you will be needing accommodation at Interrobang 2018. Registration for the QuizFest is Rs. 800 per person. This covers accommodation (2 days + 1 night), breakfast on both days, and the registration fee for all 5 quizzes. (If you won't require accommodation, you can register for the quizzes on the spot). Rooms are limited and will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis.
If you require accommodation for a longer duration, please email us at quizzing@nalsar.ac.in BEFORE filling this form.
Rules, Regulations and Eligibility Criteria:
•Teams should consist of THREE members or less.
•Cross-college teams ARE allowed. 
•The quiz is open to students pursuing full-time degrees from institutes that are affiliated to universities or are universities themselves.
•The quizzes are only for those doing their undergraduate degrees (this includes those enrolled in integrated Masters/PhDs) and postgraduate students born after 20th January, 1992.
•It is NOT open for teams from courses run by professional associations such as ICAI, ICSI etc. This list is merely indicative and NOT exhaustive.
•Participants pursuing degrees through distance mode learning are NOT eligible.
•Participants pursuing Diploma courses are NOT eligible.
Identification cards will have to be carried by all participants.

Over the last semester the Quiz Club has seen a flurry of activities, with numerous meetings in which quizzes from every possible genres were covered. Apart from our regular meetings, the regulars of Quiz Club participated actively in quizzes being held in surrounding cities and secured numerous podium finishes there. Here we present to you a compilation of the achievements of the Quiz Club over the last semester. 

Winners, Swedish India Nobel Memorial Quiz, Kolkata Round (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Piyush Kedia and Shreyans Sadangi)
Winners, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy)
1st Runner Up, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Baibhab Pattnaik)
2nd Runner Up, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Rishabh Madan, Sourav Kundu, Venkatesh Pai)
Winners, Prashnavali, General Quiz at IIEST Shibpur (team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia)
2nd Runners Up, General Quiz at IIEST Shibpur (team of Baibhab Pattnaik, Shreyans Sadangi)
Winners, Quiz on the Beach, Kolkata Round (team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)
Winners, Kharagpur Open (team of team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)
Winners, General Quiz, XLRI Ensemble Valhalla, Jamshedpur (team of Ashutosh Dwivedi and Piyush Kedia)
Runners Up, General Quiz- Quizmat Qonnection, Scottish Church College, Kolkata (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi and Shubham)
Runners Up, Biz Quiz, Intaglio at IIM Calcutta (team of Harsh Agarwal, Piyush Kedia and Shreyans Sadangi)
Runners Up, General Quiz, Intaglio at IIM Calcutta (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Harsh Agarwal and Piyush Kedia)

The IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club congratulates all the winners and hopes that the team continues their winning momentum as the Quiz contingent heads to IIT Kanpur for the Social Cultural Meet.

message:
We are pleased to announce that the V Edition of Interrobang, NALSAR’s annual college Quiz Festival will be conducted on 20th and 21st January, 2018 at our campus in Shameerpet, Hyderabad. Over the past five years, Interrobang has become one of India’s biggest quiz festivals and this edition promises to deliver the same.

Over the weekend, we have got 5 quizzes lined up for college students with a fantastic prize pool in store. Headlining the event is Major Chandrakant Nair, who will be hosting two quizzes. 

This is the line-up and schedule of Interrobang 2018:

20th January, 2018, 10 am: BizSciTech Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair 

20th January, 2018, 2 pm: MELAS Quiz by Jayavardhan Josyula and Siddharth Rajeevan

20th January, 2018, 6 pm: Attorney General Quiz by Balaji Subramanian and Anubhav Sachdeva (this is a written general quiz with a legal element to each question and is designed for non-law students)

21st January, 2018, 10 am: India Quiz by Lokesh Kaza

21st January, 2018, 2 pm: General Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair

The eligibility criteria for college students can be checked out on our event page at https://www.facebook.com/events/1969612729926441/. 

We shall announce details pertaining to registration and prize money break-up shortly on the event page. We suggest that you book your tickets well in advance and hope to see you attend in great numbers.  

See you in Janauary! Any queries may be addressed to quizzing@nalsar.ac.in.

message: Quiz Club, IIT Kharagpur would be hosting Brainbusters 2017 in association with Quiz Dubai tomorrow at 4pm in F-127. All the interested students are requested to fill-up the attached Google form by 12 noon tomorrow.
